lexUnit.name: circle.n

corpus.description: Wall Street Journal Texts from the PropBank Project
corpus.name: PropBank

lexUnit.definition: COD: round plane figure whose boundary consists of points equidistant from the centre.

sentence.text: She stopped and looked at the garden ; inside the square was a circle of flower beds .
Open pastureland succeeded the neglected wood as I walked on , and soon I came to a rough circle of boulders on a mound -- Lisheen , the little fort , home of fairies .
It would be misleading therefore , effectively to write off the outer circle of kin as significant sources of support in British society .
He gathered his own particular circle of close advisers around him and was prone to discount views that did not reflect those prevailing in his own circle .
Laputa is a circle of land , about eight kilometres across , covered with houses and other buildings .
She had made her a cool and sweet-smelling bed of grasses inside a circle of powder to keep away ants and other insects .
Alexei 's favourite spot was in what he supposed might have been termed a clearing -- at least it was in the centre of a circle of four rocks , each one the size of a crouching man .
Some kung fu clubs place a blindfolded student amid a circle of fellow students , who attack him with one technique at intermittent intervals .
Over to your right in the distance , half-hidden by a fold of land , is a broken circle of stone monoliths .
A circle of hungry crows soared noisily above a clump of oak trees , branches black against the lightening sky .
For a moment he seemed almost not to see the bright silver circle that lay in her palm .

The form and position of stone circles , tree clumps and wells strongly suggest a ritual approach along an ancient trackway , as if walking the paths that others have trod before encourages the energies to manifest .
The stone circles appear to have had some sort of tradition of dancing , perhaps associated with these key times .
Take a small piece of glass , lay a circle of acrylic sealant or putty around the edges , and press it firmly to the floor , putty side down .
When she held it up to the light she saw that a small circle of skin was inflamed .
Round her burned iron-spiked circles of tapering candles , yellow-bright in the dark .
Towards the street corner a single papier-mach dragon bobbed in the centre of a circle of dancing men .
It was built for Doctor Wills and his family , whose initials are let into the circles of brickwork in the gables .
Brush the tops of all the little circles of cake with glaze .
Spread a little buttercream over the centre of the marzipan circle and place the second cake on top of this .
a Human skull on one table has a circle of copper banding around its forehead .
Roll out a circle of red icing and slice into eight 5mm ( inch ) strips .
An orange circle of light , the beam from his torch , darted round the tent walls , there was the jingle of keys and I felt them cold in my hand .
He gestured towards the darkness beyond the circle of light .
Huy struck a flint and the lamp spread a tight circle of yellow light , so deep that it drew objects into it .
Then out of the darkness appeared a little white circle of light .
A spot will throw a concentrated circle of light and is therefore best directed down on to , say , a bowl of flowers or a plant .
Line a cake tin 1618 cm ( 67 inches ) in diameter with a circle of greaseproof paper .
You do not need to line tins for Victoria sponge cake as it is so light , but a circle or square of paper cut to fit the bottom of the tin will ensure an easy turn-out .
Line the bottom of the basin only with paper by cutting out a circle of paper about 5cm ( 2inches ) larger than the base of the bowl .
You can also use a circle of wire netting , shaped like a mound , to cover the top of the container .
She had no companion in this snow wilderness with its circles of wire .

Ten shirt-sleeved ringers stand in a circle , one foot ahead of the other in a prize-fighter 's stance , each pulling a rope that disappears through a small hole in the high ceiling of the ringing chamber .
